Register.definition: a written record containing regular entries of items or details ;specif
Register.origin: [Anglo-French registre , from Medieval Latin registrum , alteration of Late Latin regesta , pl., register, from Latin, neuter plural of regestus , past participle of regerere to bring back, pile up, collect]

1.definition: to enroll one's name in a register

2 a.definition: a book or system of public records (as titles or patents)

sub_terms.b: a roster of qualified or available individuals
sub_terms.c: the formal record maintained by a corporation of the names and addresses of holders of its registered securities

3.definition: to secure special protection for (a piece of mail) by prepayment of a fee

2.definition: to enroll one's name officially as a prerequisite for voting
